intro: Opuntia microdasys var. rufida, commonly known as the red prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its flat, paddle-shaped stems covered in clusters of spiny areoles. The plant produces vibrant red or yellow flowers, which are followed by edible, fleshy fruits. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick stems. This variety is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and has cultural significance in some regions.
